Package BobcatLib.Hardware.Motors

Class BaseMotor

java.lang.Object
BobcatLib.Hardware.Motors.BaseMotor
public class BaseMotor extends Object
The BaseMotor class serves as a wrapper for motor functionality, providing methods for controlling and monitoring motor operations. It interacts with a MotorIO implementation for hardware abstraction.

  • Constructor Details

    • BaseMotor

      public BaseMotor(MotorIO io, SoftwareLimitWrapper limits)
      Constructs a new BaseMotor instance.
      Parameters:
      io - The MotorIO implementation to be used for motor control and feedback.
      limits - A SoftwareLimitWrapper instance to handle motor software limits.

    • BaseMotor

      public BaseMotor(CANDeviceDetails details, MotorConfigs mc, String motor_type, SoftwareLimitWrapper limits)

  • Method Details

    • periodic

      public void periodic()
      Periodically updates the motor inputs and processes them. This method should be called frequently to ensure the motor's state is up-to-date.

    • getPosition

      public Rotation2d getPosition()
      Retrieves the current position of the motor as a Rotation2d object.
      Returns:
      The motor's position as a Rotation2d instance.

    • getVelocity

      public double getVelocity()
      Retrieves the current velocity of the motor.
      Returns:
      The motor's velocity in meters per second.

    • stopMotor

      public void stopMotor()
      Stops the motor and performs a fault check to ensure no issues are present.

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed(double speedInMPS, double mechanismCircumference, boolean isOpenLoop)
      Sets the motor's speed.
      Parameters:
      speedInMPS - The desired speed in meters per second.
      mechanismCircumference - The circumference of the mechanism connected to the motor.
      isOpenLoop - Whether the speed control should be open-loop.

    • setAngle

      public void setAngle(double angleInRotations)
      Sets the motor's angle in rotations.
      Parameters:
      angleInRotations - The desired angle in rotations.

    • setControl

      public void setControl(double volts)
      Sets the motor control voltage for SysID mode.
      Parameters:
      volts - The control voltage to apply to the motor.

    • checkForFaults

      public void checkForFaults()
      Performs a fault check on the motor to detect and handle any issues.

    • getMotor

      public MotorIO getMotor()
      Retrieves the MotorIO implementation associated with this BaseMotor.
      Returns:
      The MotorIO instance being used for motor control and feedback.

    • getCanId

      public int getCanId()
      Retrieves the CAN ID of the motor.
      Returns:
      The motor's CAN ID.

    • withLimits

      public BaseMotor withLimits(Rotation2d lower, Rotation2d upper)
      Configures the motor with both lower and upper software limits.
      Parameters:
      lower - The lower limit as a Rotation2d instance.
      upper - The upper limit as a Rotation2d instance.
      Returns:
      The updated BaseMotor instance.

    • withUpperLimit

      public BaseMotor withUpperLimit(Rotation2d rotations)
      Configures the motor with an upper software limit.
      Parameters:
      rotations - The upper limit as a Rotation2d instance.
      Returns:
      The updated BaseMotor instance.

    • withLowerLimit

      public BaseMotor withLowerLimit(Rotation2d rotations)
      Configures the motor with a lower software limit.
      Parameters:
      rotations - The lower limit as a Rotation2d instance.
      Returns:
      The updated BaseMotor instance.
